question: You decided to add more EC2 Instance & load balance the web application's traffic between the EC2 Instances. Which load balancer you SHOULD NOT choose?
explanation: Because Network Load Balancer only used to make routing decision at TCP (or Layer 4 traffic)

question: You're the CTO of a startup company and have a small team of developers. You would prefer your team to focus on product development and bring value into the product and spending a minimum amount of time in managing & configuring the deployment. Which AWS Service could help you to achieve this?
explanation: Elastic Beanstalk provisions and operates the infrastructure and manages the application stack (platform) for you, so you don't have to spend the time or develop the expertise. (From AWS Official Website). Developers could just focus on the code.

question: You are running an application using Elastic Container Service (ECS). You would like to use the most cost-effective approach. Which task placement strategy would you choose to achieve your desired result?
explanation: Explanation: Tasks are placed on container instances so as to leave the least amount of unused CPU or memory. This strategy minimizes the number of container instances in use (from AWS Docs). Simply saying, it allow you to use the CPU & memory of the instance till the max, which create lesser EC2 instances. The lesser the number of instances, the cost is lower.

question: Below are the supported deployment strategies for Elastic Beanstalk EXCEPT:
explanation: The supported deployment strategies for Elastic Beanstalk are all at once, rolling, rolling with additional batch, and immutable.

question: You decided to setup a development environment using Elastic Beanstalk. Which deployment strategy is the MOST suitable for the above scenario?
explanation: All at once deployment strategy allows you to deploy your code to the existing instances in the shortest time.

question: Which of the following are the benefits of the Elastic Beanstalk deployment strategy: Immutable EXCEPT:

answers.a: Minimal Impact if failed deployment happened.

explanation: Immutable deployment strategy has the longest deployment time compared to other deployment strategies. This is because the Immutable deployment strategy has to create a new auto-scaling group & new instances.

question: What is the maximum number of application versions that Elastic Beanstalk can store?
explanation: This is the application version quota set by AWS. The quota might changed by AWS from time to time.

question: Which of the following options allow you to manage your Elastic Beanstalk application version?
explanation: Elastic Beanstalk Lifecycle Policy allows you to configure settings to remove old application versions.

question: Below are the valid lifecycle rules for Elastic Beanstalk Lifecycle Policy EXCEPT:

answers.a: Set the application versions limit based on total count of application version
answers.b: Set the application versions limit based on least recently used (LRU) strategy
answers.c: Set the application versions limit based on the age of application versions.

explanation: Lifecycle Policy only allows you to configure lifecycle rule using total count & age. Lifecycle Policy will not be able to delete your application version based on the usage.

question: Your company decided to keep the source bundle for deployments. Can Elastic Beanstalk Lifecycle Policy help you to achieve this?
explanation: Elastic Beanstalk Lifecycle Policy has the option to allow you to retain the source bundle in S3 to prevent data loss.

question: You would like your Elastic Beanstalk application always running in full capacity during deployment time. Which deployment strategy would be able to achieve this?
explanation: Rolling with additional batches always creates a new batch of instances and deploys the new version on the new batch of instances before update the rest of the instances. This ensures our application run at full capacity at all time.

question: Which Amazon Services offer features such as Github, which allow you to store source code?
explanation: Code Commit is similar to Github, which allows having repository to store source code.

question: Which protocol you can use to perform your Git operations in AWS Code Commit?
explanation: AWS Code Commit supported both SSH and HTTPS like other providers such as Github, Gitlab and etc.

question: Which stages in CodePipeline can create artifact?
explanation: Every stages in CodePipeline can create articfact and passed on to the next stage

question: Your company's management decided to add more control to every deployment. So, now the approval of CTO is needed before release to production. Can we achieve that via Code Pipeline?
explanation: We can add an action group in the pipeline which this pipeline is require manual approval from CTO before proceed to the next deployment stage

question: Which AWS Service allow you to build and run automated test for your application?
explanation: Code Build allow you to build your application and run test for your application. If tests failed, it will not proceed to next stage.

question: Below are the benefits of CodeBuild EXCEPT:

answers.c: Continuous Scaling - Able to scale based on your usage without worry the build queue is full and etc.

explanation: CodeBuild is pay based on usage. If you have lesser build for this month, then you will enjoy lower cost.

question: Which file you should have in order for CodeBuild to run successfully
explanation: CodeBuild uses the build specification (buildspec.yml) file to run a build. This file should be located in the root of the folder.

question: Your build time in CodeBuild is pretty long and you would like to optimize your build. Which of the follow could help you achieve that?
explanation: AWS S3 Cache Bucket allows you to cache some of the reuseable pieces such as dependencies, avoid re-downloading dependencies & save time.

question: You're facing difficulty in finding errors for your CodeBuild in AWS Console. Which tools you can use to enable you identify the errors faster so you could fix it?
explanation: AWS CodeBuild Local Build allows you to identify and fix errors faster from your local development environment.

question: In order to let CodeBuild to run successfully, we need to have buildspec.yml located at where?

answers.c: At the root of the directory

explanation: buildspec.yml file should always reside at the root of the directory.

question: Which could be the reason that your application did not deploy successfully into EC2 Instances after you run the AWS Code Deploy Service?

answers.a: You did not install Code Deploy Agent in your EC2 Instances
answers.b: Your directory do not have buildspec.yml file
answers.c: Your EC2 Instances is located at different availability zones.

explanation: In order to use CodeDeploy, EC2 Instances have to install CodeDeploy agent in their machine.

question: What is the correct CodeDeploy Hooks Order for EC2 Instance?

answers.a: Application Stop, Download Bundle, Before Install, Install, After Install, Application Start, Validate Service
answers.b: Download Bundle, Before Install, Install, After Install, Application Stop, Application Restart, Validate Service
answers.c: Download Bundle, Before Install, Install, After Install, Application Stop, Validate Service, Application Start

explanation: The correct hooks order for CodeDeploy is Application Stop, Download Bundle, Before Install, Install, After Install, Application Start, Validate Service.

question: In which stage you should perform health check to verify the AWS Code Deploy is success and your application is working fine?
explanation: We can perform health check during this phase and make sure the application is running as expected.

question: Below are correct about AWS Auto Scaling Group EXCEPT:

answers.a: Scale out (Add EC2 Instance) when load is increase
answers.b: Register new EC2 Instances automatically to the Auto Scaling Group
answers.c: Help you save cost by removing all the EC2 Instances when there is no usage.

explanation: Auto Scaling Group always ensure there is a minimum number of EC2 Instance running even when there is no usage at all.

question: By default, how long the produced message can remain in the AWS SQS queue?
explanation: The message can remain in the AWS SQS queue for 4 days by default and you can configure the message to persist up to 14 days.

question: Your team are discussing to persist the queue message for longer period of time for the AWS SQS queue. They came to you and ask what is the longest possible time the message could persist?
explanation: You can configure the message in the queue to persist up to 14 days for AWS SQS queue.

question: Your Consumer Application received a message from the AWS SQS queue, however it took few minutes for your application to process the message. Meanwhile, you realized the message was also consumed by other consumers and it cause your message was processed several times. What you can do for this situation?

answers.c: Increase delivery delay to the message

explanation: Increase message visibility timeout meaning other consumers would not be able to see the message in the queue during the duration of configured timeout. Thus, other consumers would not be able to receive & process this message.

question: If the message from the AWS SQS queue was prcoessed failed, you would like message stored somewhere so your developers could debug later. What you should do?

answers.c: Grouping the failed to process message

explanation: Dead Letter Queue is useful for debugging and it provides your developers the message content so you can discover the possibly reasons for failure.

question: AWS SQS queue allows you to enable for long polling. What is the maximum long polling wait time you configure?
explanation: AWS allows you to configure maximum 20 seconds of long polling time. Simply meaning your consumer will wait for messages in 20 seconds if there is none in the queue.

question: Which of the following are the benefits for long polling in AWS SQS queue EXCEPT:

answers.a: Allow you to receive and consume for more messages.
answers.b: Reduce empty responses by allow wait until a message is available until timeout
answers.c: Reduce cost by reduce the number of API to call for consume message

explanation: Even with long polling, the message is send to consumer as soon as it is available. So, it won't accumulate the message.

question: The message size limit for AWS Queue is 256KB. However, what you can do in order to send larger messages such as 100MB or even 1GB?

answers.a: Add message delay to allow consumer have more time to process the message
answers.c: Use FIFO Queue to order message

explanation: SQS Extended Client allow you to specify large message whether to store in AWS S3, whuch you can retrieve the message from S3 to process by your consumer application.

question: Which one in the below is NOT the benefits of AWS FIFO (First-In First-Out) Queue?

answers.b: Unlimited number of transactions per second

explanation: AWS FIFO Queue provives benefits such as message ordering and prevents message duplication, but with limited number of transaction per second.

question: How do you identify a SQS queue is FIFO (First In First Out) queue?
explanation: You can identify based on the queue name. All fifo queue must ends with suffix .fifo

question: AWS SQS FIFO queue has the minimum deduplication interval to help you prevent duplicate message such as if your client accidentally click twice for the payment. How long is the minimum depduplication inteval for SQS?
explanation: The minimum deduplication interval is 5 minutes, if you resend the same message within 5 minutes, the queue will treat it as a duplicate.

question: Below are the supported deduplication method for AWS SQS FIFO queue EXCEPT:

answers.a: Content based deduplicaton using MD5 to hash the message body
answers.b: Content based deduplicaton using SHA-256 to hash the message body
answers.c: Explicitly provide a message deduplication id

explanation: The deduplication method are Content based deduplicaton using SHA-256 hash or Explicitly provide a message deduplication id.

question: You would like to have multiple consumers for the SQS FIFO Queue for parallel processing, which of the below options allow you to do so?

answers.c: No. You're not able to perform that in SQS FIFO queue.

explanation: Message that share the same Message Group Id will be within the same gorup and each Group Id can have a different consumer (parallel processing).

question: You're developing a feature where when users registered, you would like to send them a welcome email and at the same time notify your sales team to follow up with the user. Which AWS Service you could leverage to achieve both requirements?
explanation: You can create a Amazon SNS topic and have 2 event subscribers, such as email service to send welcome email and notification service to send notification to sales team to subscribe the topic and act on the message respectively.
